enrolled-dateline.#text: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Friday, the third day of January, two thousand and fourteen

congress.#text: One Hundred Thirteenth Congress of the United States of America

official-title.#text: To amend the Social Security Act to provide for the termination of social security benefits for individuals who participated in Nazi persecution, and for other purposes.

role.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives.
Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: No Social Security for Nazis Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: No Social Security for Nazis Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
Congress enacted social security legislation to provide earned benefits for workers and their families, should they retire, become disabled, or die.

Congress never intended for participants in Nazi persecution to be allowed to enter the United States or to reap the benefits of United States residency or citizenship, including participation in the Nation’s Social Security program.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended to read as follows:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 202(n)(3) of the Social Security Act

text.#text: For purposes of paragraphs (1) and (2) of this subsection—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: on grounds of participation in Nazi persecution shall be considered to have been removed under such section as of the date on which such order became final;
